intro: Dianthera obtusifolia, commonly known as the bluntleaf dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves with a rounded base and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
